page.title: 07PROCESSING BELHAVEN BEER.
page.content: Belhaven Brewery was established in the Middle Ages by monks and is situated in the Belhaven area of Dunbar. The raw materials needed are malt, hops, yeast and water. The local hard water gives the beer its unusal flavour. The water supply is from a well around which the brewery was built. Hops come from Worcestershire and Kent. Types of beer include Strong Ale, Sweet Stout, 6O/-, 7O/- and 8O/-. These beers are sold all over Britain and in Italy, Hong Kong and Texas. Production continues to expand owing to increased exports and the success of the Real Ale Campaign.
